headline.seo: Nestlé to Invest $500 Million in Health Care Nutrition
headline.print_headline: Nestlé to Expand Business in Health Care Nutrition
headline.main: Nestlé to Expand Business in Health Care Nutrition

docs.lead_paragraph: The company will seek to develop nutritional products for diseases like diabetes, obesity, cardiovascular disease and Alzheimer’s.
docs.snippet: The company will seek to develop nutritional products for diseases like diabetes, obesity, cardiovascular disease and Alzheimer’s.

headline.seo: Obesity Costs Women More, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: DISPARITIES: Obesity Costs Women More, Study Finds
headline.main: Disparities: Obesity Costs Women More, Study Finds

docs.lead_paragraph: Though men’s earnings don’t appear to be affected by weight, obese women earn less relative to working women who are not obese, researchers say.
docs.snippet: Though men’s earnings don’t appear to be affected by weight, obese women earn less relative to working women who are not obese, researchers say.

docs.abstract: Food experts discuss renaming of corn syrup (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: The companies that make high-fructose corn syrup want to pick a new name for the sweetener, so we're asking Well readers to help. We asked a panel of nutrition experts what they thought about the term ''corn sugar,'' which is the name suggested by the Corn Refiners Association. We also asked them to offer their own ideas.
docs.snippet: The companies that make high-fructose corn syrup want to pick a new name for the sweetener, so we're asking Well readers to help.     We asked a panel of nutrition experts what they thought about the term ''corn sugar,'' which is the name suggested...

docs.abstract: Scientists are finding that what happens around you in the womb can affect you for the rest of your life.
docs.lead_paragraph: Over the centuries, most cultures have believed - and then dismissed the belief - that what happens to you in the nine months before you are born can affect everything that you become in life.
docs.snippet: Scientists are finding that what happens around you in the womb can affect you for the rest of your life.

headline.main: Nestle Seeks to Expand in Health Foods

docs.abstract: The Swiss food giant Nestlé said Monday that it would seek to expand in the profitable health and wellness sectors by setting up a new unit and investing hundreds of millions of dollars in medical research.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Swiss food giant Nestlé said Monday that it would seek to expand in the profitable health and wellness sectors by setting up a new unit and investing hundreds of millions of dollars in medical research, Matthew Saltmarsh reports in The New York Times.
docs.snippet: The Swiss food giant Nestlé said Monday that it would seek to expand in the profitable health and wellness sectors by setting up a new unit and investing hundreds of millions of dollars in medical research.

headline.print_headline: BLUEPRINTS FOR THE MIDEAST: In Arabian Desert, a Sustainable City Rises, Walled and Lofty
headline.main: In Arabian Desert, a Sustainable City Rises

docs.lead_paragraph: Promoters of Masdar, a city being built near Abu Dhabi, say that it will be the first carbon-neutral city.
docs.snippet: Promoters of Masdar, a city being built near Abu Dhabi, say that it will be the first carbon-neutral city.

headline.print_headline: Told to Eat Its Vegetables, America Orders Fries
headline.main: Told to Eat Its Vegetables, America Orders Fries

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite two decades of public health initiatives, a study found Americans still aren’t eating enough vegetables.
docs.snippet: Despite two decades of public health initiatives, a study found Americans still aren’t eating enough vegetables.

headline.seo: Obama Allies Fear School Lunch Bill Will Rob Food Stamp Program
headline.print_headline: Some Obama Allies Fear School Lunch Bill Could Rob Food Stamp Program
headline.main: Some Obama Allies Fear School Lunch Bill Could Rob Food Stamp Program

docs.lead_paragraph: At issue is how to pay for additional spending on school lunch programs and other child nutrition projects sought by the White House.

docs.abstract: Student Opinion | What dangers and risks do your parents worry about most?
docs.lead_paragraph: An article in the Week in Review discusses the risks that parents worry about most -- and contrasts them with the dangers that are actually more likely to affect kids. What do your parents worry about when it comes to your safety and welfare? What rules do they have that are designed to keep you safe?
docs.snippet: Student Opinion | What dangers and risks do your parents worry about most?
